mentions.context: DESeq provided p-values for an exact test which were next adjusted to p-value FDRs for multiple testing with the Benjamini-Hochberg procedure [41].
The final contingency table was obtained using a Perl custom script and imported in R v 2.11.0 [39].
The final contingency table was obtained using a Perl custom script and imported in R v 2.11.0 [39].
Differentially expressed contigs between FLAP and SLAP were identified using the DESeq package v. 1.8.3 [40], applying a method based on the negative binomial model implemented in R software.
Annotation of the differentially expressed contigs between FLAP and SLAP was performed using BLASTX (BLASTX 2.2.23) against the NCBI nonredundant database using an E-value cutoff of 10 -5 .
Annotation of the differentially expressed contigs between FLAP and SLAP was performed using BLASTX (BLASTX 2.2.23) against the NCBI nonredundant database using an E-value cutoff of 10 -5 .
Processed Illumina datasets FLAP and SLAP were aligned on the S. littoralis reference transcriptome [32] with Bowtie [37].
For both FLAP and SLAP datasets, the number of reads aligned on each contig from the reference transcriptome was counted with SAMtools [38].

Gene-specific primers for three S. littoralis regulated contigs (c6022, encoding a putative odorant-degrading enzyme: ODE; c997 and c65324, both encoding candidate chemosensory proteins: CSPs [32]) and for the reference gene rpL8 were designed using Primer3Plus v. 2.3.0 [42] (Table S1), yielding PCR products ranging from 100 to 200 bp.
